key_events.description: BTLG Jundiaí experienced a contractual revision resulting in a 31% increase in rent.

The latest dividend per share was R$0.79, with an ex-date of January 16, 2026, and a payment date of January 23, 2026. The next dividend per share will be R$0.79, with an ex-date of January 16, 2026, and a payment date of January 23, 2026.
XP is expecting BTLG11 to maintain distributions close to the guidance between R$0.78 and R$0.84 per share during the first semester of 2025.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Potential growth from renovations and contractual revisions. Assets were recycled at prices 27% above appraisal in the last three years.
investment_thesis.bear_case: No specific data on current vs. last month vacancy was found. Distributions are only expected to maintain guidance between R$0.78 and R$0.84 per share during the first semester of 2025.

summary_markdown: BTLG11's portfolio saw a positive impact from a contractual revision at BTLG Jundiaí, leading to a 31% rent increase. The latest dividend per share was R$0.79, with an ex-date of January 16, 2026, and a payment date of January 23, 2026. The next dividend per share will be R$0.79, with an ex-date of January 16, 2026, and a payment date of January 23, 2026. XP expects BTLG11 to maintain distributions close to the guidance between R$0.78 and R$0.84 per share during the first semester of 2025. The portfolio's cap rate is around 8%, and assets were recycled at prices 27% above appraisal in the last three years.
